results.title: Summertime
results.creator_credit: Rob McCubbin and Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre
results.brief_description: A non-narrated montage of a series of images to give an impression of the Australian summer, ranging from country scenes to suburban beaches.

results.title: Summer of the seventeenth doll [discussion]
results.brief_description: Peter Fitzpatrick from Monash University is an expert on Ray Lawler’s play. He looks at its dramatic heritage and how the play farewells the myth of the male bush hero by showing what hapens when the old values of the outback hero and urban domesticity are in conflict.
results.description: Peter Fitzpatrick from Monash University is an expert on Ray Lawler’s play. He looks at its dramatic heritage and how the play farewells the myth of the male bush hero by showing what hapens when the old values of the outback hero and urban domesticity are in conflict.

results.title: Summer of the seventeenth doll [Australian Opera]
results.brief_description: Ray Lawler’s classic play, set in Melbourne in the 1950’s, is brought to life in this operatic adaptation recorded at the Playhouse, Victorian Arts Centre. Cast includes Elizabeth Campbell, Gillian Sullivan, Natalie Jones, Eilene Hannan, Barry Ryan, Gary Rowley and Nicholas Todorovic. Music by the Victorian State Opera is composed and conducted by Richard Mills. Performance produced and directed by Peter Butler.

results.title: Summer interlude
results.brief_description: The lives of the inhabitants of a Swedish seaboard village that becomes a resort in summer are contrasted with those of visitors. The atmosphere of a little fishing village is beautifully caught - the impact of trippers on it equally well described. The film has all the best of Sucksdorff’s qualities - a strong pictorial style, human observation, and a simple flowing narrative.

results.title: Sulphur and its compounds. - 2nd ed.
results.brief_description: Using molecular models, animation and time-lapse photography, this film demonstrates the chemical and physical properties of sulphur, including the formation of its allotropic forms. Also describes the Frasch process, and emphasises the importance of sulphur and its compounds, especially sulphuric acid, in modern industry, medicine and agriculture.

results.title: Suho and the white horse
results.brief_description: Legend has it that love shared by a poor shepherd lad and the white foal he finds on the Mongolian steppes underlies the creation of the first horse-head fiddle. A deeply moving story based on the children’s picture book.
results.description: Legend has it that love shared by a poor shepherd lad and the white foal he finds on the Mongolian steppes underlies the creation of the first horse-head fiddle. A deeply moving story based on the children’s picture book.

results.title: Sugar bowl island
results.brief_description: Few of the world’s basic foods have so romantic and beautiful a source as sugar cane from the island of Mauritius. This film gives an account of its famous sugar industry and a general impression of life among the island’s various racial communities.

results.title: Suez in perspective
results.brief_description: A statement of the events which led to the action by Britain and France to arrest hostilities in the Suez Canal/Port Said area in 1957. An account is given of the allied operation, why it was considered necessary and the care with which it was carried out.
